page.title: 09THE CAPTAIN'S WIFE
page.content: The Captain's Wife was converted from a row of cottages into a pub in 1976. It is situated on the coast at Swanbridge overlooking Sully Island and its causeway. It is a long low white painted complex of buildings surrounding a flagstoned courtyard in which there is a well of very great age and a dovecote of great beauty. There is a bar and 2 restaurants. The bar has exposed stone walls. There is an old black kitchen range and antique settles. Upstairs is a restaurant with a gallery overlooking the main bar. The pub was originally the stables of the old Sully Manor House. The well is thought to have been in use in Celtic times and still contains fresh water at a depth below sea level.
